verses.kjv: In the twenty and seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah to reign.
verses.web: In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah began to reign.
verses.ct: Azariah son of Amaziah became king of Judah during the 27th year of King Jeroboam of Israel's reign.

verses.kjv: Sixteen years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned two and fifty years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Jecholiah of Jerusalem.
verses.web: He was sixteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He was 16 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 52 years. His mother was Jecholiah of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father Amaziah had done;
verses.web: He did that which was right in LORD’s eyes, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.
verses.ct: The LORD was pleased with what he did, just as his father Amaziah had done before him.

verses.kjv: Save that the high places were not removed: the people sacrificed and burnt incense still on the high places.
verses.web: However the high places were not taken away. The people still sacrificed and burned incense in the high places.
verses.ct: Even so, the hilltop shrines were never torn down, and the people kept offering sacrifices and burning incense there.

verses.kjv: And the LORD smote the king, so that he was a leper unto the day of his death, and dwelt in a several house. And Jotham the king’s son was over the house, judging the people of the land.
verses.web: LORD struck the king, so that he was a leper to the day of his death, and lived in a separate house. Jotham, the king’s son was over the household, judging the people of the land.
verses.ct: The LORD struck the king with leprosy that lasted until the day he died, and he had to live in a separate house. His son Jotham took charge of the palace and governed the people of the land.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Azariah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Azariah, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else about Azariah's reign and all he accomplished is recorded in the official history of Judah's kings.

verses.kjv: So Azariah slept with his fathers; and they buried him with his fathers in the city of David: and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Azariah slept with his fathers; and they buried him with his fathers in David’s city: and Jotham his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Azariah died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David. His son Jotham became king after him.

verses.kjv: In the thirty and eighth year of Azariah king of Judah did Zachariah the son of Jeroboam reign over Israel in Samaria six months.
verses.web: In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah, Zechariah the son of Jeroboam reigned over Israel in Samaria six months.
verses.ct: Zachariah son of Jeroboam became king of Israel in Samaria during the 38th year of King Azariah of Judah's reign. He ruled for 6 months.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, as his fathers had done: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, as his fathers had done. He didn’t depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil, just like his ancestors before him. He never turned away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.kjv: And Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him, and smote him before the people, and slew him, and reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him, and struck him before the people, and killed him, and reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Shallum son of Jabesh plotted against him, struck him down in front of the people, killed him, and took the throne.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Zachariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Zechariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Everything else about Zachariah's reign is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: This was the word of the LORD which he spake unto Jehu, saying, Thy sons shall sit on the throne of Israel unto the fourth generation. And so it came to pass.
verses.web: This was LORD’s word which he spoke to Jehu, saying, “Your sons to the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel.” So it came to pass.
verses.ct: This fulfilled what the LORD had promised Jehu: "Your descendants will sit on the throne of Israel to the 4th generation." And that's exactly what happened.

verses.kjv: Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the nine and thirtieth year of Uzziah king of Judah; and he reigned a full month in Samaria.
verses.web: Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah king of Judah, and he reigned for a month in Samaria.
verses.ct: Shallum son of Jabesh became king during the 39th year of King Uzziah of Judah's reign, but he ruled in Samaria for only one full month.

verses.kjv: For Menahem the son of Gadi went up from Tirzah, and came to Samaria, and smote Shallum the son of Jabesh in Samaria, and slew him, and reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Menahem the son of Gadi went up from Tirzah, came to Samaria, struck Shallum the son of Jabesh in Samaria, killed him, and reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Menahem son of Gadi marched from Tirzah to Samaria, struck down Shallum son of Jabesh, killed him, and took the throne.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Shallum, and his conspiracy which he made, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Shallum, and his conspiracy which he made, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Everything else about Shallum's reign, including the conspiracy he carried out, is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: Then Menahem smote Tiphsah, and all that were therein, and the coasts thereof from Tirzah: because they opened not to him, therefore he smote it; and all the women therein that were with child he ripped up.
verses.web: Then Menahem attacked Tiphsah, and all who were in it, and its border areas, from Tirzah. He attacked it because they didn’t open their gates to him, and he ripped up all their women who were with child.
verses.ct: Menahem then attacked Tiphsah and everyone in it, along with its surrounding territory from Tirzah. Because the city refused to open its gates to him, he attacked it and ripped open all the pregnant women.

verses.kjv: In the nine and thirtieth year of Azariah king of Judah began Menahem the son of Gadi to reign over Israel, and reigned ten years in Samaria.
verses.web: In the thirty ninth year of Azariah king of Judah, Menahem the son of Gadi began to reign over Israel for ten years in Samaria.
verses.ct: Menahem son of Gadi became king of Israel during the 39th year of King Azariah of Judah's reign, and he ruled in Samaria for 10 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD: he departed not all his days from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight. He didn’t depart all his days from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil. Throughout his entire reign, he never turned away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.kjv: And Pul the king of Assyria came against the land: and Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver, that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
verses.web: Pul the king of Assyria came against the land, and Menahem gave Pul one thousand talents of silver, that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
verses.ct: Pul, the king of Assyria, invaded the land. Menahem paid him 1,000 talents of silver so that Pul would back him and help secure his grip on the throne.

verses.kjv: And Menahem exacted the money of Israel, even of all the mighty men of wealth, of each man fifty shekels of silver, to give to the king of Assyria. So the king of Assyria turned back, and stayed not there in the land.
verses.web: Menahem exacted the money from Israel, even from all the mighty men of wealth, from each man fifty shekels of silver, to give to the king of Assyria. So the king of Assyria turned back, and didn’t stay there in the land.
verses.ct: Menahem raised this money by forcing every wealthy man in Israel to pay 50 shekels of silver each, which he handed over to the king of Assyria. With that, the Assyrian king withdrew and didn't stay in the land.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Menahem's reign and all he did is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: And Menahem slept with his fathers; and Pekahiah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Menahem slept with his fathers, and Pekahiah his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Menahem died, and his son Pekahiah became king after him.

verses.kjv: In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekahiah the son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned two years.
verses.web: In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah, Pekahiah the son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria for two years.
verses.ct: Pekahiah son of Menahem became king of Israel in Samaria during the 50th year of King Azariah of Judah's reign, and he ruled for 2 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight. He didn’t depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil. He never turned away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.kjv: But Pekah the son of Remaliah, a captain of his, conspired against him, and smote him in Samaria, in the palace of the king’s house, with Argob and Arieh, and with him fifty men of the Gileadites: and he killed him, and reigned in his room.
verses.web: Pekah the son of Remaliah, his captain, conspired against him and attacked him in Samaria, in the fortress of the king’s house, with Argob and Arieh; and with him were fifty men of the Gileadites. He killed him, and reigned in his place.
verses.ct: One of his officers, Pekah son of Remaliah, plotted against him and attacked him inside the fortress of the royal palace in Samaria, along with Argob and Arieh. Pekah had 50 men from Gilead with him. He killed Pekahiah and took the throne.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Pekahiah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Pekahiah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Everything else about Pekahiah's reign and all he did is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: In the two and fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekah the son of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned twenty years.
verses.web: In the fifty-second year of Azariah king of Judah, Pekah the son of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria for twenty years.
verses.ct: Pekah son of Remaliah became king of Israel in Samaria during the 52nd year of King Azariah of Judah's reign, and he ruled for 20 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight. He didn’t depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil. He never turned away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who had led Israel into sin.

verses.kjv: In the days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglathpileser king of Assyria, and took Ijon, and Abelbethmaachah, and Janoah, and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Gilead, and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali, and carried them captive to Assyria.
verses.web: In the days of Pekah king of Israel, Tiglath Pileser king of Assyria came and took Ijon, Abel Beth Maacah, Janoah, Kedesh, Hazor, Gilead, and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali; and he carried them captive to Assyria.
verses.ct: During Pekah's reign, King Tiglathpileser of Assyria invaded and captured Ijon, Abelbethmaachah, Janoah, Kedesh, Hazor, Gilead, and Galilee — the entire territory of Naphtali — and deported the people to Assyria.

verses.kjv: And Hoshea the son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the son of Remaliah, and smote him, and slew him, and reigned in his stead, in the twentieth year of Jotham the son of Uzziah.
verses.web: Hoshea the son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the son of Remaliah, attacked him, killed him, and reigned in his place, in the twentieth year of Jotham the son of Uzziah.
verses.ct: Hoshea son of Elah plotted against Pekah son of Remaliah, attacked him, killed him, and took the throne. This happened in the 20th year of Jotham son of Uzziah.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Pekah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Pekah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Everything else about Pekah's reign and all he did is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: In the second year of Pekah the son of Remaliah king of Israel began Jotham the son of Uzziah king of Judah to reign.
verses.web: In the second year of Pekah the son of Remaliah king of Israel, Jotham the son of Uzziah king of Judah began to reign.
verses.ct: Jotham son of Uzziah became king of Judah during the 2nd year of King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel's reign.

verses.kjv: Five and twenty years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Jerusha, the daughter of Zadok.
verses.web: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jerusha the daughter of Zadok.
verses.ct: He was 25 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 16 years. His mother was Jerusha, the daughter of Zadok.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD: he did according to all that his father Uzziah had done.
verses.web: He did that which was right in LORD’s eyes. He did according to all that his father Uzziah had done.
verses.ct: The LORD was pleased with what he did. He followed the example of everything his father Uzziah had done.

verses.kjv: Howbeit the high places were not removed: the people sacrificed and burned incense still in the high places. He built the higher gate of the house of the LORD.
verses.web: However the high places were not taken away. The people still sacrificed and burned incense in the high places. He built the upper gate of LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Even so, the hilltop shrines were never torn down, and the people kept offering sacrifices and burning incense there. Jotham did build the upper gate of the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else about Jotham's reign and all he accomplished is recorded in the official history of Judah's kings.

verses.kjv: In those days the LORD began to send against Judah Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah.
verses.web: In those days, LORD began to send Rezin the king of Syria and Pekah the son of Remaliah against Judah.
verses.ct: During those days, the LORD began sending King Rezin of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah to attack Judah.

verses.kjv: And Jotham slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Ahaz his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Jotham slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in his father David’s city, and Ahaz his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Jotham died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David. His son Ahaz became king after him.
